direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want. Thou makest me to lie down in green pastures. Thy rod and staff they comfort me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There is a thunderous noise. Part of the mountain is tossed into the air. Up from the depths comes a huge shining wing. Then a neck uncoils and a head appears. It tips down toward the tiny human.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the base of the slope the villagers scatter. Greil wavers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dragon's head sways back and forth, then belches out a waterfall of flame. It engulfs Jacopus and sends him to a better world, if there is one.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (firm) ...for Thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever -- amen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unclean beast, get thee down! Be thou consumed by the fires that made you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Horse and rider race across a night landscape under brooding clouds. Up ahead, the sky glows with an angry red light. At the crest of a hill Galen reins in and looks down across a long valley. There, miles away, is the village of Swanscombe. Many buildings are ablaze. As he watches in horror, fires spring up in the fields and trees. Intermittently he can see the silhouette of the dragon as it spreads destruction. Finally the creature swoops up and away. Galen stares skyward, losing sight of it in the clouds. For a moment, silence. Then, with a thunderous rush of air that almost blows him from the saddle, the dragon reappears and hurtles a few feet over his head! It is gone in an instant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half the buildings in the town are on fire. Desperate villagers dash here and there, herding children and animals to safety, trying to save their household goods. Galen walks woodenly into the confusion, leading his horse, taking in the scope of the disaster. He comes upon a line of men who have formed a bucket brigade. He attempts to join up. As soon as he is recognized, he is shouldered roughly aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen staggers back, reaching for his horse. The animal shies and trots off. A middle-aged woman appears in front of him, her face contorted with rage. She swings a flaming broom and catches him on the back of the head. Galen reels away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen looks up and sees a couple of burlies moving his way with boards in their hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before they can get too close, Galen runs down an alley and bumps smack into a glassy-eyed, haunted man. It is Greil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pushes past. Galen ducks behind a smoldering building.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get away, you little bastard. We've had enough help from you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is your doing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get him! He's back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Greil -- help!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May the Lord forgive you for what you have done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The roof has burned off, but at least the walls are standing. Valerian is wrestling charred timbers out of the center of the room. She is covered with soot. There is a hammering on the door and Galen barges in. He slams the door behind him and puts his back against it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen's hand moves up to where the amulet used to hang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a moment, Valerian is too stunned to speak. Then her face colors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen sinks to the floor and sits in the ashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She snatches up a pitchfork and glowers at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Galen still sits there like a puppet with its strings cut, every dream of glory utterly crushed. This piteous sight touches Valerian's heart. Her gaze softens. She slowly lowers the pitchfork.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's me. Are you hurt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where have you been? Doesn't matter -- listen: Quick! Make it rain. That'll put the fire out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then get the animals back. They're all running loose. There's people been hurt. Stop their pain. You can cure them. And we'll need food...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (this stops her) What? Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you're a sorcerer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm no sorcerer. Whatever power I might have had, it's gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It can't be!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know: I'm an imposter. A fraud. A fake. I'm sorry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're sorry?! Listen to that! The damn thing is loose, we're all on fire and you're sorry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't have the faintest idea what you were doing, did you? You're a fool -- and I'm a bigger one for bringing you here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want you in this house. Get out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A knot of villagers lead Tyrian and his henchmen across the square directly to the blacksmith's shop. The King's men dismount and pound on the door. It swings open. Valerian is standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cry goes up from the villagers. They know damn well he's in there.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not here. I can't help you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tyrian pushes Valerian aside and steps into the room. Aided by some townfolk, his men proceed to ransack the premises, overturning barrels, sticking their swords through flour sacks, poking through the tumbledown thatch. Valerian's eye falls on Malkin, who has involved himself in the search.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finding nothing, the group pushes into the metal shop, where Simon is hammering an iron wheel rim back into shape on an enormous anvil. He lays down his tools and grimly watches the men go through, overturning benches and tables. Tyrian props a leg up on the anvil and addresses himself to Simon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The search party has exhausted the room's hiding places.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrian nods and leads the way out. Simon catches up and pulls Tyrian aside at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spins on his heel and joins his men as they ride out of town. Valerian and Simon watch them go. When the riders are out of sight, they return to the shop. With a couple of stout poles, they strain to lift the anvil off its base. Finally it topples over. Valerian slides the base aside, revealing a trap door. She raises it and a cramped Galen unfolds himself from the space below. On his face is a curious look of determination.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (returning her look) Damn right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As the proud new father of an eligible daughter who was some-how overlooked all these years, it may interest you to know that the King has called for a new lottery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it's months til the solstice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In view of what's happened, we all know what's required.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've never taken part in your cursed lottery, and I'll have nothing to do with it now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were very clever. But she'll take part, like all the rest. No exceptions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing. If he was here, he's gone now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. I know what you want. How much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you offering me a bribe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't waste your time. (pause) You could never afford it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smith -- have you ever forged a weapon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Simon is going through a cabinet, tossing out hoes, rakes, sickles, scythes, plow blades, and a knife or two. Galen examines them doubtfully. Now Simon produces an armload of swords. Galen is impressed; he looks them over carefully, testing and rejecting them in turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon plucks up one of the swords, carries it to the center of the room. He lays a horseshoe on the anvil. He brings the sword down -- whack! -- and cuts the horseshoe in half.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen hefts it dubiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian has been watching all this with growing concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon gnaws his lip. Reluctantly, he brings a long box from the bottom of the cabinet. He opens it. Lying on a bed of silk is an exquisite two-handed broadsword. The flat blade gleams like a mirror. Galen reaches in and lifts it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian is as awed as Galen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen brings up a finger to test the edge. Simon grabs his hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at him with affection. Leaning forward, she plants a kiss on his bald pate.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: These are your sharpest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Even Tyrian carries one of these.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's sharp -- but it's not sharp enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not sharp enough for what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For what I'm going to do with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing's that sharp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The best I ever made.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't do that! (he looks at Valerian) Girl-child, when you were born I knew I had to do something, so I set about the task of fashioning an extraordinary weapon: I had the skill to make it -- (bleak pause)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: but not the nerve to use it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm thankful for that. (to Galen) No man should choose a senseless death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Galen, Valerian and Simon tramp through a glade to a mossy bank. There a wide stream flows lazily under a canopy of trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen walks out into the shallows and pushes the sword-tip into the sandy bottom, angled so that the edge splits the current.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks back to shore. All three watch the sword to see what will happen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If it's me you're worried about, don't. So my name has been entered, what of it? There are hundreds of girls. My name just won't be drawn. I know it won't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Valerian, this isn't just for your sake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Big flat oak leaves are gliding along the current. Very slowly, they go by the sword, some of them very close. Finally, one of them floats against the leading edge of the blade and without a ripple is cleft in two. Simon gives Galen a significant look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look to Galen. The apprentice's face is full of doubt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care. It doesn't matter. What you want to kill isn't flesh and blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, it'll bleed, all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know? No one's so much as even scratched it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll need the amulet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carrying torches to light their way, families -- some with maiden daughters -- gather from all over the country in the courtyard of the King's castle. Simon is there with Valerian, and so is Galen, disguised in rough farm clothes and a wide- brimmed hat. Like many others, he carries a stick topped with a bleached skull -- to all appearances, just another participant in this weird pagan ritual. A barrel decorated with flames and dragon's wings sits on a raised dais in front of the main entrance. Horsrik, the King's herald, supervises preparations for the lottery. Armed guards appear carrying a sealed chest. Horsrik breaks the seal and the guards pour the contents -- hundreds of wooden tiles, each bearing the name of a potential sacrifice -- into the barrel. Trumpets blare and drums roll and the royal party strolls onstage: the King, his daughter, courtiers and Tyrian. Valerian nudges Galen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian gives Galen a sharp look. Horsrik unrolls a parchment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen pulls his hat low over his eyes. As the moment for the drawing approaches, Valerian becomes more and more uneasy. She pushes forward through the crowd until she's just below the barrel. She eyes the people around her. Some of them seem equally worried, others -- the better dressed and better fed -- are smug and complacent. The King and his retinue are serene. A chant goes up from the crowd:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Horsrik picks up a wooden staff surmounted by a carved dragon's head and stirs up the names. This done, a new chant goes up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At a signal, a guard comes forward and cuts the sleeve from Horsrik's right arm. He holds it high. The crowd surges forward. The atmosphere is full of dread and excitement. Valerian looking pale and determined, is jostled and pushed to the edge of the platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The moment has come. Down goes Horsrik's arm and up it comes, holding one little wooden square, one young woman's fate. An expectant hush falls over the mob. The virgins of Urland tremble and wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks down at the tile to read the name, but no sound comes to his lips. He looks back at the crowd, a cold sweat breaking over his face. He swallows, but still can't bring himself to speak. At his feet, Valerian is holding her breath. A new chant goes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By now Horsrik is trembling. He stares down at the tile, his mouth set in a grim line. The King is getting annoyed. He gestures and the crowd falls silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a moment of profound shock. Then a low murmur of wonder moves through the crowd. Galen looks at Valerian; she sags with relief. The King turns to his daughter. She shows nothing. He rises from his chair, comes forward and snatches the tile from Horsrik.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian will not stand for such hypocrisy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He quickly tosses the wood chip into a brazier at his elbow. Led by Valerian, the crowd cries out in protest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches into the barrel and extracts another tile. He looks at it and his eyes widen. Betrayed, he swivels to face his daughter. The din of the crowd reaches a crescendo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elspeth takes the tile from her father's nerveless fingers, looks at it with satisfaction and holds it aloft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The King moils through the tiles, finding his daughter's name again and again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian, chanting with the rest, falls silent. She looks at Elspeth with sudden interest and respect, then awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd is dumbfounded. Gradually voices erupt in a cacophony of shouts, whistles and excited conversation. Galen sees his chance: there's an unguarded door near the stable. He drifts toward it and slips inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) Look at her. The Princess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. We've met.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading) People of Urland: whereas the peace of the kingdom has been disrupted by the mischief of an interloper; and whereas this interloper being fled; now therefore, his majesty the King hereby proclaims the sum of thirty ducats to be paid to anyone producing the miscreant Galen Bradwardyn, fraud enchanter, to our satisfaction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stir the tiles! Stir the tiles!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bare the arm! Bare the arm!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Draw the name! Draw the name!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, my countrymen, hear me: behold, for I am chosen. I shall die that many may live. I shall lay down my life for family and fellows. I shall go to my grave for the love of our King and his wise policy. And my name is --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The name! The name!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Read the name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mastering himself) The name is: Princess Elspeth Ulfilas, filia regis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not the name. It's been misread.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's no mistake! The name's been chosen -- let it stand!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, the good Horsrik has misspoke himself. (he looks at the tile) In fairness to this individual, whose name I can't make out, we'll destroy this tile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! What better name than your own kin? At last we see justice done!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silence! We will have a new choosing. I will draw the name myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let it stand! Let it stand!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The name is as you heard it and as Horsrik read it: Elspeth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The lottery is invalid. Another and another. What treachery is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hear me, good people! It is true, that my name appears on many of the lots. This does not falsify the drawing, it certifies it! I have learned that my name has been kept from jeopardy in all the drawings in the past. So I have put my name among the rest many times -- once for each risk that, over the years, you took and I did not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Galen pokes his head in: the room is empty. He scurries over to a chest, flings it open and starts rummaging. Finding nothing he moves on to a cabinet. He breaks the lock and pries it open. Again, nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen can hear the voices in the courtyard as he rushes down a hall. Suddenly he stops short. There in front of him is a guard leaning out a window to watch the proceedings. Galen hovers on the verge of panic as the guard abruptly moves. But the man is only headed for another window and a better view. Galen manages to fall into step an arm's length behind him and slip by without a sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen enters the library, his enormous shadow dancing crazily on the torchlit walls. Hurrying through, his attention is drawn to some open books on a table. Closer inspection reveals magical writings and symbols. Galen paws over everything, suddenly aware that he must be close to the amulet. But where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the crowd disperses Valerian watches Elspeth walk back in the castle, lofty and composed. She looks for Galen and discovers he has gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By now, the room is in total disarray. Galen has opened all the chests and trunks and knocked half the books from the shelves. No amulet. He's feverishly working on a locked drawer when a voice interrupts him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen whirls around to find the King standing in the doorway. The monarch looks shattered. Galen edges toward the split in the wall and finds that it has been shored up with timbers. At that moment Tyrian comes through the door, sizes up the situation and draws his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The King's voice is cracking. Galen and Tyrian are equally taken aback. The King searches through the books remaining on the library shelves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The King finds the book and takes the amulet out. With trembling hands, he passes it to Galen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't go to all that trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm unarmed. If you want a fight, at least give me a weapon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pushing by the King) I think not!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop! Don't harm him. (to Galen) And you -- don't run away... please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaky) I've always had the greatest admiration for the black arts. You chaps with your mysterious spells... I didn't think it would be necessary, you see. Vermithrax is an old dragon. And that, I thought, was the beauty of my plan -- buying time. We'd wait her out. I'd live to see the end of her. (firm) That's still going to happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sire!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He shall have it. (pleading) It's my daughter. Save her, I beg you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The people of Swanscombe are clearing up the rubble and beginning repairs on their dwellings. Standing in their midst, lecturing every passerby, is Greil. He holds up the charred remains of Brother Jacopus' wooden cross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some workmen go by lugging new thatch. Malkin is with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malkin and the others stop to listen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Holy of holies -- he did not die in vain. Can you hear me, brothers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gently) We hear you, Greil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well and good, but I'm Greil no longer. Call me Gregorius, after the Bishop of Rome.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw him die. Like Our Lord Jesus on the cross he was, scourged by evil. But he showed no fear. Such is the power of the Holy Ghost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Galen lurks in the shadows of Simon's metal shop looking out on the square where Greil is holding forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen quietly shuts and bars the door. He moves deeper into the gloomy workroom where Simon is pumping a bellows to heat up the forge. Galen looks at the coals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian is staring at the sword, sitting on the anvil in its silk wrapping. Galen uncovers it, holds it high, and puts his hand on the amulet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sword starts to hum and to heat up. From the hilt outward the blade glows brighter and brighter: red, orange, white. It lights up the room, throwing long shadows into the corners. Galen lays the white hot steel on the anvil. Simon takes up his hammer and begins the reforging. Valerian sees their resolve. After watching for several moments she slips out the side door, looking sad.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Of what avail is magic? The old gods died with our daughters. From whence comest my help? My help comest from the Lord!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good and hot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't bother. That's not the kind of fire we need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nunc, per Potestatem Hermeticum -- ex flammis, ferrum sangrinarium!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clouds scud low over the lifeless region. The dragon's lair now has a newer, bigger entrance. Vapors drift upward from it. Down the slope a lonely figure works its way from rock to rock: it's Valerian with a wicker basket on her arm, searching for dragon scales. The basket is already more than half full when she finds herself ominously near the mouth of the cavern. She's about to turn back when she spies a particularly large and beautiful scale just a few yards further on. As she reaches for it, there is a sudden hiss! She jerks her hand back and freezes. There in the shadows is a baby dragon, a basilisk, all coppery bronze with stubby winglets. As she backs away, she sees two more come up to join the first. They watch her retreat through wicked little green eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the mossy bank Galen and Simon unwrap the reforged sword. Now the blade carries a faint blue halation. Galen walks to the middle of the current and once again stabs the tip down into the sand. Then he rejoins Simon onshore to await results. This time, as the oak leaves approach the sharp edge, they gently but definitely veer sideways to avoid contact. Such is the power of the sword that even after many leaves, not a single one has come close enough to be sliced. Simon is agog and even Galen seems satisfied. They clasp hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon hands him a bundle of fighting equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other for what could be the last time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old man departs. Galen unfolds the bundle and brings out its contents: mail hauberk with coif, studded leather gloves, padded jerkin, a scabbard and a small wooden shield. He lays them out on the stream bank, then strips off his tunic and kneels down to splash some water in his face. As the cups the water between his hands, an image comes alive and shimmers on the surface: Valerian, stripping off her own clothes, shyly turning toward him, solemn and romantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's as if the vision is speaking to him, but it's not. He spins around and sees her standing there, fully clothed, and possessed of a brisk and businesslike air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She throws down a shield. It's remarkable in its construction -- overlapping layers of iridescent dragon scales have been ingeniously fastened to a leather-clad frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen turns the shield over and over, marveling at it. He fixes her with a piercing look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shudders. Galen's eyes are still fastened on her. She's fighting to retain her hard manner, but the agitation and dread are plain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian wants to be bold, but on this final point, can't muster the courage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen takes her in his arms; she is trembling. He tilts her face up toward his and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their image is reflected in the waters. Through the ripples she is visible pulling briefly away to remove her clothes. From afar, they are two tiny figures under the overarching oaks and willows. They embrace and sink down into the deep grass beside the water. The leaves continue their unhurried course downstream.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: An edge like no other on this earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well done, Simon. Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grave) I'll say goodbye to Valerian for you. I'm sorry she's not here, but you know how she is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fare thee well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Galen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a shield. I made it. Might keep the fire off you. Might not. You know, you're an idiot. You're going to die tonight. You'll be ripped limb from limb. This is the last time I'll ever speak to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rushing) Another thing. That thing isn't alone up there. There's little ones. Young, I think. I don't know how many.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hatchlings. They'll have to be killed too. Anything else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tiny voice) You're in love, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly nodding) Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all right. I understand. She's very beautiful, very brave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is? What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your Princess. But I don't care. It doesn't change the way I feel. (firm) Listen to me, Galen Bradwardyn, sorcerer's apprentice; you're going to be dead, the dragon will be worse than ever, there will be more lotteries, and I'm not a boy any more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you'll be eligible because -- VALERIAN Because I'm still a virgin, and I want you to do something about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am in love. But not with the Princess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A cold wind whistles through the rocks near the dragon's lair. By the light of a flickering torch two workmen finish driving a heavy post into the ground. As they affix a pair of iron manacles they see the torches of a procession coming up the slope. They hurry down to meet it. Horsrik is in the lead, followed by soldiers and royal attendants. Elspeth rides in the tumbril behind a blindfolded horse. Bringing up the rear is Tyrian. At last the cart can go no further. Elspeth alights and leads the rest of the troop to the post. As the soldiers put the irons around her wrists, Horsrik unrolls a parchment, turns his back on the wind and begins to read:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Horsrik blinks. There's a black stain growing in the middle of the parchment; all at once it bursts into flames. He cries out and flings the document away. There follows a flash of light and a puff of smoke and Galen is standing there, as if he had materialized out of thin air. Horsrik and his startled men backpedal down the slope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen raises his hands in a menacing gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough for Horsrik and company: he and the soldiers depart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only one man remains behind the challenge the young sorcerer: Tyrian. He draws his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen draws his own sword. As it emerges into the night air it seems imbued with a blue phosphorescence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elspeth twists around in her chains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen starts to reply, but as soon as his attention wavers, Tyrian is lunging toward him, sword point directed at his neck. Galen barely manages to parry the thrust before Tyrian is at him again, blade swinging toward his knees. Galen drops the tip of his sword to catch the blow. When the two steel edges connect, sparks fly. In a series of thrusts and counter- thrusts, each accompanied by a shower of sparks, Tyrian backs Galen up the mountain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure enough, at that moment the earth gives out a low moan and undulates in a sickening movement. Vapors begin rising from the lair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He might be right, for Galen turns and bolts across the slope. When he reaches the post with Tyrian two steps behind, he whirls and brings his blade down on Princess Elspeth's chains. The chains part in an explosion of sparks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Princess darts from the piling as Tyrian swoops down to continue the attack. Galen dodges and the stake catches Tyrian's blow. The earth shakes again. Galen glances at the Princess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elspeth is not running away down the mountain. Instead she is walking, slowly and deliberately, right into the smoking cave. Swoosh! Tyrian's sword comes down again. The dismayed sorcerer ducks back and Tyrian's blade again bites deep into the wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's now or never. Elspeth is no longer in sight. Galen grits his teeth, grasps the sword with two hands and swings it as hard as he can in a wide arc. The blade never even slows down as it sails right through the post, lopping it clean off. The glowing sword flashes above Galen's head and eagerly buries itself in Tyrian's chest. The King's man is as startled by the amputated piling as he is by his own death. His eyes roll up in his head, his knees buckle and he topples backward -- the blade sliding free.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now be it known throughout the kingdom, that the Princess, having been chosen by a deed of fortune and destiny --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No fire, I beg you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be gone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over his shoulder) I declare these proceedings duly ordained...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew I'd find you here. Well, I'm not as sentimental as some. The kingdom, every one of us, need this sacrifice. If you intend to interfere, you'll have to kill me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got plenty of reasons to kill you that have nothing to do with this sacrifice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Most impressive. Can you use it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let it be! Please! Tyrian is right -- it's our only hope!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tyrian -- both of you -- run! Flee! It's coming!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In a trice! This is no swords-man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Run! Get out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! Stop! What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've failed, my friend, and I thank the gods for it. Come out from behind that post.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Smoke swirls at the mouth of the cave as Galen enters, holding his sword before him, lighting his way with its faint blue glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The floor of the cave as it winds down into the mountain is paved first with rock, then with dragon scales, then with bones. With each footfall, clusters of mysterious insects scuttle away. Galen pauses to mop his brow; it's getting hot. A sound echoes up from the depths, a grinding sound like the gnashing of teeth, followed by hissing and squealing. Galen grips his sword tighter and pushes on. Suddenly he stoops and picks up an embroidered slipper: Elspeth's. The grinding sounds are louder. He hurries forward and rounds a corner. He stops and gags.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Elspeth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two disgusting little reptiles -- like scaly raccoons -- are perched on the corpse of Princess Elspeth Ulfilas, feeding contentiously on choice bits of the royal flesh. Galen groans: he lashes out and his sword beheads one of the tiny monsters. The other one buzzes its half-formed winglets and hisses a hot stream of air. Galen brings down the sword and slices it in half. Eyes riveted on Elspeth's remains, he edges around the carnage and backs away. Hissss! -- there's a third one, lurking in the shadows, munching on something; it might be a hand. Galen shrieks and jumps away. The little creature comes at him and clamps its jaws on his leg. Galen stabs at it repeatedly. Finally it lets go, and flails and flops across the bloody floor, ululating its death agony. As the creature's last mewlings echo down through the cavern, the ground quivers. Bits of stone fall from the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen works his way down a narrow passage whose walls are alive with insects and beads of sulphurous water. As before, he holds the sword in front of him; he marvels at its increasing brightness. The heat is increasing too; sweat mats his hair and runs down his face. A few yards further on the sword starts pulsating. Now the walls take on a flickering rosy sheen and the passage widens into an underground vista of staggering immensity: an underground lake, its surface bubbling and torn with sheets of flame. Arching over it is a vault of stone, penetrated here and there by natural chimneys. The dimensions of this internal world are unknown -- the fiery lake disappears into half a dozen side chambers. The one clear path is accessible only by a series of flat stones leading across the hot liquid. Galen grips his sword and resolutely hops from rock to rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's halfway across when the earth rumbles and the stepping stones teeter beneath his feet. A fiery wave washes over his legs, leaving his boots smoking. Another tremor knocks Galen to his knees. As he scrabbles to pick up his sword and shield, the great head of Vermithrax rises up out of the depths on its long neck. It gazes at him through huge pale eyes under armored lids. A tongue flicks out and runs around its lipless mouth. The head sways from side to side. The mouth hinges open, the nostril-like igniters come on and touch off the jet of gas squeezed up out of its innards. A roaring tube of flame engulfs Galen. He crouches behind his dragon scale shield which deflects the fire just enough to save his life. The dragon pauses to take a breath. Galen springs to his feet, and bounds back the way he came, his skin and clothing singed. Flames lick at his back as the dragon lets fly with a second burst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coughing and weeping, Galen staggers up through the tunnel, nearly tripping over the body of one of the baby dragons. A few seconds later, Vermithrax follows, squirming and clawing its way upward. When it reaches its dead offspring it surveys the scene with expressionless eyes. Bringing its head low, it sniffs and nudges at the lifeless little ones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At that moment Galen leaps out from behind a niche in the tunnel wall and lunges forward. Striking sparks, the point of his sword slides across the dragon's plated cheek and stabs deep between the scales of its heavy neck. There is an unearthly shriek and the creature flicks its head back and upward. Galen goes sprawling and finds himself holding half a sword. The rest is buried in the beast's neck, and Vermithrax doesn't like it. It flings its head this way and that, knocking rocks loose from the ceiling. Its movements cause the ground to quake. As boulders tumble around him, Galen drops to the floor under his shield. Dragon flame reaches through the cascading debris and washes over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian roams the rock-strewn slope not far from the dragon's lair. Presently she comes upon a once-familiar object -- the fire shield. Half the scales are gone, the rest are charred and curling. Grimly, she moves on. A few paces away she picks up the blunted sword. She scans the rocks and finally sees what she's looking for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lying face down behind a boulder, his clothes charred, patches of skin scorched. He looks dead. Valerian rolls him onto his back. She gasps: the eyes are open, regarding her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Still alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Simon is standing by the anvil with the broken sword in his hand, lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the adjoining house Valerian tends Galen's wounds. He's propped up on a palette enduring the application of poultices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He winces in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seems miles away. She turns aside, on the verge of tears. Simon is standing there, still holding the sword hilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen looks at him; he has heard everything. He sits up and fondly regards Valerian.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know what we have to do. (he looks at her with dull eyes) We have to leave Urland.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not because of what happened. I brought you here -- it didn't work -- now I'm taking you away. Do you understand? (Galen does not react) You said you loved me. Is it true? If it is, it's the only good we've done. Let's not lose that too. (pause) Galen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's right. What kind of a life could you have here? It's too late for me, but you're young enough. (he shows them the sword) You know what I think? Magic is dying out, fading from the world. But that makes me happy. That means the dragon will be dying too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Valerian packs her belongings into a rucksack. The last item in is her blue frock, carefully rolled. Beside her, Galen dons clean traveling clothes. He stiffly crosses the room and drags his pack out of the corner. He sorts through the effects, and amidst the clothing and supplies discovers the leather pouch containing Ulrich's remains. He contemplates it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tucks the pouch away, throws some clothes on top and ties the satchel shut.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing. I was just thinking -- poor Hodge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Beside the quiet stream Simon bids farewell to the young couple, embracing each in turn. They slosh across the shallow water and follow a path into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greil is standing outside the half-burned grange hall, summoning the Christian faithful. He proclaims the call to worship by hammering on a small bell. One by one the townsfolk arrive. Among them is Simon, looking bereft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerian and Galen trudge along side by side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is small consolation, and Galen sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches out to take his hand. But Galen is no longer at her side. She stops and looks back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How's your leg?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurts. That thing was small, but its teeth were sharp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At least you killed it. You got all the young.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But the big one's alive. Somewhere down in that burning lake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't think about it. You had your fight, and you're still here. That's more than anyone else can say. Let's think about what lies ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Galen has come to a halt in the middle of the path. He's staring into the middle distance with a sudden inspiration bubbling in his brain. He flings off his sack, drops to his knees and tears through the contents. Valerian comes back, baffled. Galen's gear is strewn all over the trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen comes up with what he's looking for -- the leather sack. When he replies, it is not to her, but to Ulrich:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He regards her with astonishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads back down the trail, leaving his belongings on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hurries after him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You old trickster! The burning water! The lake of fire!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Galen, what are you saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He had it planned. He knew this was going to happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who did? What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to go back, I want to talk to him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Greil, a.k.a. Gregorious, stands in the center of the burned- out granary, delivering a sermon. Behind him, men are filling the baptismal cistern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the gathering Simon ponders the hilt of his once fabulous sword. With its blade shortened, it looks a lot like a crucifix.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Church is mother to us all. Not just one lonely orphan who has lost his way, not just a few, but all of us that believeth in Him. When enough voices come together in prayer, He shall hear, we shall live and the beast shall die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Galen bounds up the rocky slope as fast as he can manage, trailed by a desperate Valerian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Galen pays no attention. In a burst of speed and fury, Valerian comes up behind and tackles him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen waves the leather pouch in Valerian's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jumps up and runs to the mouth of the lair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tackles him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Valerian springs to her feet and starts into the lair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen pauses long enough to snatch up a discarded torch near the remains of the wooden stake, then charges after her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Galen, stop! Please, I beg you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop! I won't let you kill yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He couldn't walk -- he knew he couldn't make the journey. So he had us make the journey for him! Don't you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pursuing) No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, all right. You're going in there, I'm going too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (brought up short) What? Why? No you're not, this is my job. Absolutely not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not afraid. And you're not going to stop me. After all -- I've been a man longer than you have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Running footsteps resound in the steamy passageway and Galen comes around the corner holding his torch high to light the way. Valerian stumbles after him. He grabs her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down and down they go. Soon they reach Elspeth's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she pulls the torch from his hand and goes over to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He darts off. In the flickering torchlight Valerian can see the Princess' remains all too clearly. She suppresses a scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer. The torch reveals several passages. She doesn't know which one to take.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stay close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind. Come on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. Wait here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Galen? Galen? Where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The passage widens out and once again Galen is standing on the shores of the lake of fire. He looks around. The water is rolling with bubbles of gas, and flames run hither and yon across the surface, but there is no sign of the dragon. Gathering his courage, he hops across the stepping stones to the middle of the lake. There he hurriedly opens the pouch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gripping the amulet with his free hand, he scatters Ulrich's ashes in a wide arc over the burning water. Instantly, there is an ominous rumble and the earth gives a shrug. But no wizard appears. No dragon, either. There follows another and stronger quake. Galen crouches to keep his balance. Still no wizard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ex favilla, vita nova!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Thoroughly bewildered, Valerian stumbles out into daylight. She wanders a few yards down the slope and collapses against the stake. Something is strange: it's getting dark. Squinting up at the sun, she frowns in puzzlement, then gapes at what is happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly and ponderously the black disk of the moon slides over the face of the sun, plunging the world into crepuscular half-light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The congregation is confused and frightened by the sudden darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The faithful bow their heads and join in. Simon as well.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Be calm. He watcheth over us! And this is His sign! Let us pray! Our Father who art in heaven...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The earthquakes have subsided; the water is calm. Galen stares bleakly into the flames. As he watches, they gather themselves into a lazy spiral. Gradually the spiral speeds up and becomes a vortex. Now the flames become tinged with green, and as the cavern moans with the sound of rushing air, a form takes shape at the crest of a jet of flame. It is Ulrich, supine as upon his pyre, reforming before Galen's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slowly raises himself into an upright posture and strides through the flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The apprentice throws himself at his master's feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ulrich! Magister! Over here! I can see you! Over here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks at him) Not so loud. I'm not deaf, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sic redit magus ex terra mortis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wonder of wonders -- you're back! I thank the powers that made me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Glad to see you, too. You didn't bring along anything to eat, by any chance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Food?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No? Oh well, no time anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Valerian is standing in the unearthly twilight, anxiously peering into the mouth of the lair. Suddenly she is hit from behind by a gust of wind. She does not turn to see the enormous Vermithrax alighting silently behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & ULRICH Ulrich raises Galen to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs his head. Ulrich regards him steadily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads the way across the rocks to the shore and into the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come along. There's much to be done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, I have something to tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It can wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No it can't. Listen: I thought I was a sorcerer -- but I wasn't. I thought I had power -- but I didn't. I thought I was you -- but I'm not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well said. Now hurry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Time seems to have come to a stop. Overhead, the moon is locked in front of the sun. At the lair, Valerian stands frozen as the dragon leans over her. The great head sways from side to side. The jaws hinge open. Suddenly, Valerian recovers herself and makes a run for it, leaping and scrabbling over the rocks. A plume of flame licks at her heels. She sees a protective crevice and heads for it, but a winged claw drops to block her way. She changes direction and is cut off again. Cat and mouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pale yellow eyes stare implacably down at the hopeless victim. The igniter jets come on, then off, as the beast suddenly stiffens. The head rotates, almost as if catching a new scent. Finally the eyes focus on the entrance to the cavern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is the sorcerer, leaning on Galen, coolly regarding the creature. The old man's expression hardens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dragon lifts its wings as if to menace them, then flaps twice and is airborne. The thing shoots overhead and, with a rush of wind, flies off into the gloom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Draco draconis...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Valerian struggles out of her hiding place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen runs to her. They embrace. When they look up, Ulrich is at their side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen's hand locates the jewel under his shirt. He finds himself reluctant to part with it. With a hurricane howl, a column of flame touches down nearby and rushes toward them. They stagger back as the dragon sweeps past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen hands his treasure over. Ulrich closes his hand around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen and Valerian approach. The old man's hand is suffused with an internal glow. Behind them, the dragon is turning for another pass.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Galen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's my amulet? Give it to me, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be quick!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come close to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: All at once the glow brightens, and in another instant the world spins off into a blur, setting all three afloat in a timeless netherworld. Valerian and Galen cling to each other in terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The voices seem to be coming from a huge distance. Starlike gleams whiz by, and fleeting glimpses of half-recognizable faces and forms. The wizard's eyes are like glittering crystals. Tiny motes and planetoids dance in the hairs of his beard. He seems wreathed in luminescence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He dangles the amulet in front of Galen. Even more reluctantly than he let it go, he takes it back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be afraid. You have served me with great courage. Now you must show me you have even more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anything!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must destroy the amulet, and me along with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You brought me from the flames, you must send me back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When the time comes, you'll understand. Here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Abruptly, the vortex is gone and they find themselves atop a rocky crag overlooking the eclipse-darkened fields and farms of Urland. Galen glances at his surroundings and stares at the amulet, full of awe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I know what you're thinking. You have learned much and done well. Don't worry, you won't need it any more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Greil is urging Simon, the last of the converts, into the cistern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He dips Simon's head under water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the background, half the congregation is staring through the burned-out walls, fervently praying and crossing themselves, wondering if they'll ever see the sun again. A cry goes up: a shape crosses the solar corona, wheels over the village and streaks away toward the mountains -- the dragon.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Make haste, brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now be thou baptized in the name of the Father, Son and Holy Ghost. May the Lord our God light our way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Galen and Valerian peer out from behind a boulder and watch Ulrich hobble perilously close to the edge of the cliff. The old man spreads wide his arms and tilts his head back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From over the horizon roiling inky-black clouds churn down upon them. Thunder booms and echoes. A bitter wind whips their clothing. As the storm gathers fury, the dragon reappears, circling in the distance. Finally it homes in on the mountain crag and dives at Ulrich. The conjurer makes a gesture and strokes of lightning explode against the beast's scaly flanks. It emits a high thin scream and rockets past.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nimbus! Tempestas! Fulmen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: & VALERIAN Valerian crawls away and comes back with a hefty chunk of granite.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here. Do as he said. Smash it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not if it means killing him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He resolutely waits as the dragon banks against the clouds and starts another pass. Again, the sorcerer summons lightning bolts. But the dragon keeps coming; this time a talon splits the old man's cape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & VALERIAN Valerian wrestles the amulet away from Galen. It falls to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lifts the chunk of stone. Galen grabs for it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You heard what he said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! You can't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Vermithrax spirals up into the storm, then drops earthward. Ulrich watches as the beast comes straight at him. He folds his arms and bows his head. Leathery wings humming, the creature levels out, swoops up past the crag and lifts the master magician away in its huge hind claw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen and Valerian are horrified to see the dragon circling upward with the sorcerer writhing in agony in its grip. As the monstrous thing flies high over them, they can hear Ulrich's faint screams.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Galen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Now Galen understands. He seizes the granite block from Valerian and raises it with both hands over his head. He takes a final look at the amulet, glowing at his feet, then brings the rock down with all his might. There is a blinding flash as it shatters into a million fragments. Far above there is another blinding flash as Ulrich's earthly body explodes against the belly of the beast. The darkened sky lights up as huge gouts of flame spew forth from the dragon's gut. Wings fluttering uselessly, this reptilian torch plummets to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below, a stock pond nestled in the foothill pastures. Trailing a wake of flame, Vermithrax plunges like a comet into the water. There is a stupendous splash and eruption of steam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & VALERIAN They stare down from their lofty perch, watching as further explosions boil the water from the pond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind a tattered wrack of cloud, the moon slowly uncovers a pale sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grey misty light reveals the beast's mangled remains. Galen and Valerian emerge from the fog, walk under a blackened wing and make their way through the mud and loose scales to the huge charred head. The death agony has twisted it upside down. The mouth is frozen in a grotesque look of surprise. The eyes are glazed. Now the sound of voices floats toward them, chanting an ancient hymn. A moment later a mob of Christians, led by Greil, crests a hill and moves toward the hulk. The song ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The members of the congregation fall to their knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen and Valerian look at each other. She takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen turns and leads Valerian away. They disappear into the mist.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let us pray.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We thank thee, Lord, for this divine deliverance. Verily is thy presence amongst us, fully manifest in this, thy great work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Arise, children of the Lord and forsake evermore the pagan mysteries. Rejoice in the true power of the Christian God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the clear light of a new day, ladders have been tipped up against the creature's back. Teams of men swarm over the crusted flesh, slicing off long strips for piecemeal burial. Below, yoked oxen drag the heavy carrion away on sledges. In the background other workmen dump the remains into an open pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the crack of a whip and the clatter of hooves, the royal coach pulls up to the shore of the lake. A door creaks open and King Casiodorus totters out. His face is puffy, his eyes are red. He slogs through the mud to the head of the dragon and commences hacking at it with a ceremonial sword. Horsrik steps out of the coach and draws himself up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The workers pause long enough to listen to this pronouncement and cast a glance at the sorry spectacle. Wordlessly they resume their labors.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (loud) All hail Casiodorus Rex -- Dragon slayer!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding) Hail and praise be!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The trail leads through copses and open meadows. Side by side, Galen and Valerian march up a long slope under a hot sun. He limps a bit; she finds a staff and hands it to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen falls a step behind. He briefly closes his eyes and mutters something. They walk on a few paces. Then there is a whinny from the nearby woods and a white stallion canters forth. It crosses a meadow, comes right up to Valerian and nuzzles her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen climbs aboard. He reaches out to help her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She thinks for a moment, then lets him help her up. Galen touches the horse's flanks with his heels and they ride off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You want to rest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I'm fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You miss Ulricn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the amulet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not me. I'm glad it's gone. I'm glad you did what you did. (he doesn't reply) You may not be a sorcerer, Galen, but I love you anyway. I don't regret anything that happened. I just wish -- GALEN Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: that we had a horse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A horse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you...!?
dialogue.name: dialogue
